marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia recorded that retail sales in Indonesia grew +9.9% MoM and +9.3% YoY in March 2024
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia recorded that sales retail in Indonesia grew +9.9% MoM and +9.3% YoY in March 2024 (vs. February 2024: +1.7% MoM and +6.4% YoY), supported by increased public activity during Ramadan, Eid al-Fitr preparations, and discount programs. Bank Indonesia projects retail sales in April 2024 to grow +3.3% MoM and +0.1% YoY.

marketNews.title: Economist projects 2024 banking credit distribution growth will only reach +7-10% YoY
marketNews.content: Senior Economist and Associate Faculty of the Indonesian Banking Development Institute, Ryan Kiryanto, projects that banking credit disbursement growth in 2024 will only reach +7-10% YoY, lower than the industry target from Bank Indonesia in the range of +10-12% YoY. Ryan bases his projection on the unconducive global economic conditions, so most banks will revise their targets downwards. Previously, Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) had revised its credit growth guidance from +11-12% YoY to +10-12% YoY, while Bank Tabungan Negara (BBTN) cut its credit growth guidance from +11-12% YoY to +10-11% YoY.

marketNews.title: Lippo Group entity purchased 10% of Bank MNC Internasional shares, while KPIG purchased 10% of Bank Nationalnobu shares
marketNews.content: Lippo group entity, PT Prima Cakrawala Sentosa, bought approximately 4.4 billion (10%) shares of PT Bank MNC Internasional Tbk (BABP) from PT MNC Land Tbk (KPIG). On the other hand, KPIG bought 747.8 million (10%) shares of PT Bank Nationalnobu Tbk (NOBU) from PT Prima Cakrawala Sentosa. Both transactions were only recorded in KSEI data as of May 8, 2024, and both issuers have not yet announced information disclosure to the IDX, but Kontan reports that the NOBU share transaction was executed at a price of 749 rupiah per share and the BABP share transaction was executed at a price of 126 rupiah per share. Previously, OJK mentioned that BABP and NOBU plan to merge, but there is no further information regarding this corporate action.

marketNews.title: OJK reports 138 public offering pipelines with an indicative value of IDR 54.33 trillion this week
marketNews.content: The Head of the Capital Market, Derivative Finance, and Carbon Exchange Supervisory Authority of OJK, Inarno Djajadi, stated on Monday (13/5) that there are 138 public offering pipelines with an indicative value of 54.33 trillion rupiah. Of this amount, there are 80 companies planning an IPO with a total indicative value of 11.38 trillion rupiah and 11 rights issues with an indicative value of 5.64 trillion rupiah.

marketNews.title: Government plans to add 50,000 EV motorcycle subsidy units if current quota is met
marketNews.content: The Chairman of the Indonesian Electric Motorcycle Industry Association, Budi Setiyadi, stated that the government plans to add 50,000 units to the 2024 electric motorcycle purchase subsidy quota if the current subsidy quota has been met. For 2024, the electric motorcycle purchase subsidy quota is only 50,000 units, down from 600,000 units in 2023 due to low realization. As of Monday (13/5), the Ministry of Industry noted that 15,109 electric motorcycles have been distributed to the public, 580 units are undergoing verification, and 11,248 units are in the registration process.

tickerNews.title: ASII share price dropped -9.75% on Ex-Date; Opportunity to Collect Minimum 5% Dividend Annually
tickerNews.content: Astra International's ($ASII) share price dropped -9.75% to 4,580 rupiah per share in trading today, Tuesday (14/5), which was the ex-dividend date. Previously, ASII distributed a final dividend for the 2023 fiscal year amounting to approximately 17 trillion rupiah or 421 rupiah per share, with a payment date on May 30, 2024. This amount indicated a final dividend yield of 8.3% based on the ASII share price during cum-dividend on Monday (13/5) at 5,075 rupiah per share. In addition to the final dividend, ASII had previously distributed an interim dividend of approximately 4 trillion rupiah or 98 rupiah per share in October 2023. Thus, in total, ASII distributed a dividend of 519 rupiah per share from 2023 net profit, equivalent to a 62% dividend payout ratio. As seen in the chart above, the trend of ASII dividend payments has tended to increase since emerging from the pandemic peak in 2020: Before the pandemic (2017-2019), ASII's dividend payout ratio was stable at 40%. Meanwhile, post-2020, the lowest dividend payout ratio was at 48%. ASII's net profit level after the pandemic (since 2022) is also higher compared to the pre-pandemic level. With today's price drop, ASII shares have weakened -18.9% YTD, triggered by various negative sentiments such as the entry of BYD and weak automotive sales. Key Takeaway: We assess that signs of bottoming in car sales figures are needed to start seeing a recovery in ASII share prices. However, in our view, the current share price provides an opportunity to collect ASII as one of the stocks that provides large and consistent dividends. Observing ASII's dividend payment track record, a conservative assumption of 239 rupiah per share, such as in 2021, would result in a dividend yield of 5.2% based on the share price of 4,580 rupiah.

tickerNews.title: ANTM: 2024 Gold Production Target Down -20.7% YoY
tickerNews.content: ANTM: Corporate Secretary of Aneka Tambang, Syarif Faisal Alkadrie, told Kontan that the company targets gold production of 958 kg in 2024, which is -20.7% lower than the 2023 realization of 1,208 kg. During 1Q24, Syarif mentioned that ANTM's gold production realization reached 166 kg or only 17.3% of the 2024 target. In 2024, ANTM has prepared an investment of 4.5 trillion rupiah. Of this amount, 1 trillion rupiah is allocated for mine exploration, 2 trillion rupiah for investment in subsidiaries, and the remainder for routine investment needs.

tickerNews.title: BREN allocates USD 160 million in capex for 2024 and plans 13.1% geothermal capacity increase in the next 2 years
tickerNews.content: BREN: President Director of Barito Renewables Energy, Hendra Soetjipto Tan, stated that the company allocates a capex of 160 million US dollars in 2024. During 1Q24, BREN has absorbed approximately 13 million US dollars in capex for the preparation of the Drajat asset drilling activities. The 2024 capex fund will also be used for periodic well maintenance. In the next 2 years, BREN plans to increase its geothermal capacity by +13.1% to 1,002 MW.

tickerNews.title: Yadea starts construction of a USD 150 million electric motorcycle factory in Karawang, to be distributed by Indomobil's subsidiary
tickerNews.content: IMAS: The Chinese electric motorcycle producer in Indonesia, PT Yadea Teknologi Indonesia, has started the construction of a factory worth 150 million US dollars in the Suryacipta industrial estate, Karawang Regency, West Java. The factory, scheduled to operate in 2026, will stand on an area of 37 hectares and have a production capacity of 3 million units of vehicles per year. In the future, Yadea electric motorcycles will be distributed by Indomobil Sukses Internasional's subsidiary, PT Indomobil Emotor Internasional.

tickerNews.title: TOTL will distribute IDR 136.4 billion dividend for 2023 fiscal year, indicating 8.5% yield
tickerNews.content: TOTL: Total Bangun Persada will distribute a dividend for the 2023 fiscal year amounting to approximately 136.4 billion rupiah or approximately 40 rupiah per share. The cum-dividend date and payment date have not been announced. Based on the TOTL share price on Tuesday (14/5) at 472 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 8.5%.

tickerNews.title: MAHA will distribute IDR 200 billion dividend for 2023 fiscal year, indicating 5.4% yield
tickerNews.content: MAHA: Mandiri Herindo Adiperkasa will distribute a dividend for the 2023 fiscal year amounting to approximately 200 billion rupiah or 12 rupiah per share. The cum-dividend date in the regular and negotiated market is May 20, 2024, with payment on June 3, 2024. Based on the MAHA share price on Tuesday (14/5) at 222 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 5.4%.

tickerNews.title: TPIA will distribute additional cash dividend from 2021 fiscal year of USD 30 million
tickerNews.content: TPIA: Chandra Asri Pacific will distribute an additional cash dividend from the 2021 fiscal year amounting to 30 million US dollars or 5.6 rupiah per share. The cum-dividend date in the regular and negotiated market is May 20, 2024, with payment on June 12, 2024. Based on the TPIA share price on Tuesday (14/5) at 8,425 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 0.06%.
